snippet: A gun battle at a remote security post near the Afghan border left 10 Pakistani soldiers dead, as well as 23 militants.
abstract: Pakistan Peoples Party and its coalition allies win 32 of 49 possible Senate seats, important milestone for Pres Asif Ali Zardari; party will dominate the upper house until March 2015, giving it the power to block legislation, even if it is defeated in general elections scheduled for Feb 2013.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan contributed reporting from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: A gun battle at a remote security post near the Afghan border left 10 Pakistani soldiers dead, as well as 23 militants.

headline.seo: Pakistan Governing Party Makes Big Gains in Senate
headline.main: Pakistan Battles Militants, in Worst Fighting in Months
headline.print_headline: Large Gains for Pakistan Governing Party
